pageContext.claim: “The Democrats have become an anti-Israel party. They've become an anti-Jewish party.”
pageContext.analysis: In reality, when Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-Minn.) employed anti-Semitic tropes to criticize the influence of pro-Israel advocates in Congress, the House passed a resolution condemning anti-Semitism and Islamophobia. Many Republicans voted for the resolution, but some, including Trump, say that adding Islamophobia to the resolution was a way to cover for Omar. In any case, Trump himself has employed anti-Semitic tropes. "You're not going to support me because I don't want your money ... you want to control your politicians, that’s fine,” he once told a Jewish audience. Of a group of neo-Nazi marchers who were chanting "Jews will not replace us" in Charlottesville, Va., Trump said some were "very fine people."
